Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to confirm the existence of a 5% COVID-19 surcharge on the restaurant receipt.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image of the receipt is genuine and accurately represents a COVID-19 surcharge.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image of the receipt has been shared on social media and reported by news outlets.
Understate: The claim may understate the prevalence of COVID-19 surcharges in restaurants by only mentioning a few establishments in a specific area.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the surcharge, such as increased food costs, supply chain disruptions, or other economic factors.
